definitions.definition: The act or state of continuing or being continued; uninterrupted extension or succession
That which extends, increases, supplements, or carries on.
examples: The series' continuation was commercially if not artistically successful.

definitions.definition: A representation of an execution state of a program at a certain point in time, which may be used at a later time to resume the execution of the program from that point.
A successful shot that, despite a foul, is made with a single continuous motion beginning before the foul, and that is therefore valid in certain forms of basketball.

main_definition: The act or state of continuing or being continued; uninterrupted extension or succession
secondary_definitions: That which extends, increases, supplements, or carries on.
( programming , countable ) A representation of an execution state of a program at a certain point in time, which may be used at a later time to resume the execution of the program from that point.
( basketball , countable ) A successful shot that, despite a foul, is made with a single continuous motion beginning before the foul, and that is therefore valid in certain forms of basketball.
